sources.title: Odd Man Out (1947)
sources.description: Belfast police conduct a door-to-door manhunt for an IRA gunman wounded in a daring robbery. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/odd-man-out-1947/

sources.title: Odd Man Out (1947) James Mason, Kathleen Ryan, Robert Newton, Cyril Cusack
sources.description: Odd Man Out is a 1947 British film NOlR directed by Carol Reed, and starring James Mason, Robert Newton, Cyril Cusack, and Kathleen Ryan. Set in a Northern Irish city, it follows a wounded Nationalist leader who attempts to evade police in the aftermath of a robbery. It is based on the 1945 novel of the same name by F. L. Green.   The film received the first BAFTA Award for Best British Film, and was also nominated for the Academy Award for Best Film Editing. Filmmaker Roman Polanski repeatedly cited Odd Man Out as his favourite film.   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia and Film Noir of the Week and Irish Central and Deep Focus Review .

metadata.Plot: The leader of an Irish separatist group's, been hiding in the house of Kathleen and her mother, planning a robbery which would give his group the money needed to continue its activities. But the robbery fails, and Johnny's wounded. Immediately a man hunt's launched, and both the police - and Kathleen go in search of Johnny, but for different reasons.
metadata.Actors: James Mason, Robert Newton, Cyril Cusack
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 4 wins & 2 nominations total
